Welcome to Complete_Intcode_Computer’s documentation!¶

main.py¶

The core module of the Intcode Computer

Complete_Intcode_Computer.main.main(program: tuple, inputA: int = 1, inputs: list = [9, 8, 7, 6, 5])¶

Starts the BOOST computer. InputA default value equals 1 (Test Mode).

classes.py¶

Contains all class objects utilized by the Intcode Computer

class Complete_Intcode_Computer.classes.Intcode(intcode)¶

Intcode class

adder(firstread, secondread, write)¶

Adds together numbers read from two positions and stores the result in a third position.

adjust_relative_base(firstread)¶

adjusts the relative base by the value of its only parameter. The relative base increases (or decreases, if the value is negative) by the value of the parameter.

equal(firstread, secondread, write)¶

if the first parameter is equal to the second parameter, it stores 1 in the position given by the third parameter. Otherwise, it stores 0

static get_opcode(number)¶

Static method to retrieve an opcode from intcode value. Returns two last digits

static get_param1(number)¶

Static method to retrieve the first parameter from intcode value. Returns hundreds digit

static get_param2(number)¶

Static method to retrieve the second parameter from intcode value. Returns thousends digit

static get_param3(number)¶

Static method to retrieve the third parameter from intcode value. Returns tens thousends digit

jump_if_false(firstread, secondread)¶

If the first parameter is zero, it sets the instruction pointer to the value from the second parameter. Otherwise, it does nothing.

jump_if_true(firstread, secondread)¶

If the first parameter is non-zero, it sets the instruction pointer to the value from the second parameter. Otherwise, it does nothing.

less_than(firstread, secondread, write)¶

if the first parameter is less than the second parameter, it stores 1 in the position given by the third parameter. Otherwise, it stores 0.

multiplier(firstread, secondread, write)¶

Multiplies the two inputs instead of adding them.

take_input(write, inputvalue)¶

Takes a single integer as input and saves it to the position given by its only parameter.

take_output(write_output)¶

Outputs the value of its only parameter.

class Complete_Intcode_Computer.classes.IntcodeIterator(intcodeobj)¶

Custom Intcode iterator object

manually_move_index(numberofplaces: int) → None¶

Moves the iterator index by specific number of places

modify_index_pointer(newpointervalue: int) → None¶

Sets the iterator index to a new value

class Complete_Intcode_Computer.classes.Intcodeoutput(intcode)¶

Intcode output observer class

setter(position, value)¶

Method to set a value in the program’s ‘memory’. First, tries to set the value at a position initially assign to the program. If the above fails, assignes the value in the ‘extended memory’ data struct

class Complete_Intcode_Computer.classes.RelativeBase¶

Object to initialize, store, retrieve, and modify program’s relative base point Uses property decorators for attribute retrieval and modification

class Complete_Intcode_Computer.classes.Runtime(name: str, intcode: tuple)¶

Runtime class

run_program(params: list) → None¶

Main coroutine generator for the Runtime class. Takes params at the initialization which are consumed by input opcode 3. Further params to be modified via the .send() method. Yields output value (at opcode 4).

utilsfuncs.py¶

Contains utility functions utilized by the classes or the main module of the Intcode Computer

Complete_Intcode_Computer.utilsfuncs.load_input(filepath)¶

Function to return a list of input variables from file

Complete_Intcode_Computer.utilsfuncs.retrieve_params(f)¶

Decorator to retrieve program command attributes, depending on their parameters (position:0, immediate:1, relative:2)
